Description: Cup of Nile silt pottery with flat base and everted rim. The exterior is coated with red slip, burnished, and decorated in creamy-white paint with panels filled with two sets of upward pointing nested chevrons delimited by a vertical line topped with a small chevron, possibly meant to represent vegetal motifs. The interior lip is slipped and burnished and decorated with five groups of five short lines running perpendicular to the rim. The rest of the interior is untreated
Curator's comments: Similar to White Cross lined ware C53 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Published: A. Scharff, Some Prehistoric Vases in the British Museum and Remarks on Egyptian Prehistory, JEA 14 (1928), p. 261, pl. xxiv.3.
Condition: fair, paint worn on one side, rim chipped.
